frameset.note: Many corpus instances covered by this frame file are somewhat ambiguous. Opening up the "view context" window and looking at the surrounding text usually clears up the ambiguity. The .02 roleset is best for truly ambiguous cases (of the aliases it covers).

roleset.name: to improve
roleset.note: BETTER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'better' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from better.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: better-v: transitive
example.text: The computer maker , which [*T*-2] sells more than half its goods outside the U.S. , also said [0]the negative effect of a stronger U.S. dollar will `` adversely affect '' its fourth-quarter performance and `` make it [*EXP*-1] difficult '' [*] to better 1988 results .

roleset.name: generally positive: morally good, pleasing; uses that mean 'well' go into a different roleset.
roleset.note: GOOD-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data. (from good.01-j)
BETTER-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.01, well.02. (from better.02-j)
BEST-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT; superlative form of good.01, well-j.01. (from best.02-j)

example.name: good-j: arg1, argMs
example.text: "when she was good she was very very good"

example.name: good-j: arg1
example.text: This cake is really good

example.name: good-j: arg1
example.text: It's all good, man.

example.name: good-j: both args
example.text: My boyfriend is good to me

example.name: better-j: arg1
example.text: This cake is much better than the last one you made.
example.arg: than the last one you made

example.name: better-j: arg1
example.text: Everything is better when its free.

example.name: better-j: both args
example.text: He was better to me than anyone had ever been.

example.name: best-j: arg1
example.text: The vanilla cake with passion fruit filling is best.
example.arg: The vanilla cake with passion fruit filling

example.name: best-j: both args
example.text: Even then, she was best to me while in need.

example.name: best-j: empty it and infinitival arg1
example.text: But if it turns you off or you ca n't come to terms with it then it s probably best to break it off .
example.arg: if it turns you off or you can't come to terms with it

roleset.name: be skilled at
roleset.note: GOOD-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ. (from good.02-j)
BETTER-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.02. (from better.03-j)
BEST-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT; superlative form of good.02. (from best.03-j)

example.name: good-j: both args
example.text: He's good at playing the piano.

example.name: good-j: arg1 only
example.text: John plays the piano; he's really good.

example.name: better-j: both args, CXN
example.text: He's better at playing the piano than I am.

example.name: better-j: arg1
example.text: As piano players, between John and Mary, John is better.

example.name: best-j: both args
example.text: Whoever posts next will post who-1 they think [*-1] is/was best at doing the move and who was the worst.

roleset.name: beneficial, healthy for
roleset.note: GOOD-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from good.04-j)
BETTER-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.04. (from better.04-j)
BEST-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT; superlative form of good.04. (from best.04-j)

example.name: good-j: both args
example.text: Broad leaf parsley is really good for you.

example.name: better-j: both args, CXN
example.text: Broad leaf parsley is better for you than eating the plate.

example.name: better-j: You say "yay", I say "neigh"
example.text: Horse meat is better for you than beef, according to a scion of one of the country's most prestigious butchery families.
example.arg: according to a scion of one of the country's most prestigious butchery families

example.name: best-j: both args
example.text: Broad leaf parsley is best for you.

roleset.name: still adequate, usable, valid (the expiration date sense)
roleset.note: GOOD-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from good.03-j)

role.descr: thing that is still good, adequate, usable, valid

example.name: good-j: with TMP
example.text: The warranty is good for two years

example.name: good-j: arg1
example.text: A simple way to find out if your baking soda is still good.

example.name: good-j: sports goal sense
example.text: "He shoots... and it's good!"

roleset.name: dependable for something (money) owed, in fortunate circumstances (non-financial)
roleset.note: GOOD-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from good.05-j)

example.name: good-j: Take that tax man!
example.text: Go ahead and slap a property tax on them too , I 'm good for it .

example.name: luxury goods
example.text: The French government raised taxes on luxury goods.

roleset.name: not as ill as before
roleset.note: WELL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from well.01-j)
BETTER-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5; comparative form of well-j.01 (from better.05-j)

example.name: well-j: both args
example.text: Thankfully, he is all well from the parasite and back to feeling good again.

example.name: better-j: both args
example.text: I am sooo relieved that he is better from his bout with rotovirus.

example.name: good-j
example.text: Is Mianmian 's tummy good now ? Will eat now !!!

roleset.name: positive state, resulting favorably (incl. 'wellbeing')
roleset.note: WELL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet; nominal 'wellbeing' based on BOLT-7. (from well.02-j)
WELLBEING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from wellbeing.02-n)
GOOD-J NOTES: Imagine you have a pedantic grandmother who yells at you for using "good" instead of "well". This roleset covers both.

role.descr: entity in a positive state, enjoying favorable results

example.name: welll-j: concatenation
example.text: All's well that ends well.

example.name: wellbeing-n
example.text: One can obtain the support of the people and have room for significant development only by working diligently for wellbeing of people 's livelihood and opening up new landscape for the nation .

example.name: good-j
example.text: How are you-1? *PRO*-1 Good?

roleset.name: gather, pool up (non-phrasal version of 'well_up')
roleset.note: WELL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'well' based on sentences in brown. (from well.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: well-v: crying
example.text: Hal felt sorry for Mary ; ; he had a time [*-1] keeping [the tears]-2 from [*-2] welling to his own eyes as he stood in the crowd in the observation dome .

roleset.name: triumph over, beat
roleset.note: BEST-V NOTES: Contest arg included b/c of comparison with other verbs of contests,such as 'beat'. (from best.01-v)

example.name: best-v: just transitive
example.text: The fact that stock pickers have bested a randomly selected portfolio in eight of 12 months has no bearing on the efficient-market theory.

example.name: best-v: with contest
example.text: John bested Mary in a battle of wits. Then Mary beat him up.

roleset.name: in fortunate circumstances (non-financial)
roleset.note: WELL_OFF-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, corresponds to good.05 (better_off). (from well.03-j)
BETTER_OFF-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5; comparative form of well-j.03, well-j.04. (from better.06-j)
BEST_OFF-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT; superlative form of well-j.03, well-j.04. (from best.05-j)

role.descr: situation/state that allows arg1 to be more fortunate

example.name: well_off-j: both args
example.text: Now we seem to face a contradiction: can it be the case, as I have argued, both that sociology is well off going its own way without direction from philosophy, and also that philosophical intrusions have shaped some of the most important sociological developments?
example.arg: going its own way without direction from philosophy

example.name: better_off-j: both args
example.text: Sony CEO Kaz Hirai has said that the company's film and device units are better off together.
example.arg: the company's film and device units

example.name: better_off-j: both args
example.text: I just happen to think people are better off doing something they actually like.

example.name: best_off-j: both args
example.text: He is best off contacting Billing directly and discussing it with them
example.arg: contacting Billing directly and discussing it with them

roleset.name: rich, wealthy
roleset.note: WELL_OFF-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet, FrameNet. (from well.04-j)

example.name: well_off-j: the arg
example.text: But while my family is well off now, that wasn't always the case.

roleset.name: well_up: gather
roleset.note: WELL_UP-V NOTES: (from well.02-v)

example.name: abstract arg1
example.text: He explained his errand , but without [*] bothering much [*-2]to make it plausible , for he felt something [*ICH*-1] well up in him [which [*T*-3] was the reason why he had fled the army [*T*-4]]-1 .
